Hi, i'm trying to implement a Event list/detail system with Title, Content, Date, and Hour. The Event list pages shoud be paginated (just like a blog). Whats the correct way to implement this? I have tries several aproachs but none worked:
- Blog: I cannot add custom fields (date and hour) to bolg posts.
- Custom modules : How can paginate and build a dinamir url for detail page?
- HubDb:  How can the final user create new events?
hubdb
thanks <@U2PDTMH53> , do you mean to build the full table in hub db? there is a way to my customer to create new events? Can you share me some link on how to build  a form or any sort of help?
why not use Eventbrite?
ramoniglesias_: by user you mean website visitors, or the marketing people needing to add/remove events to be shown on the website?
marketing people
they’ll just add/remove lines from the hubdb table
:slightly_smiling_face: yea. with "final users" i mean content creator. The web owner, non the web visitors
it’s straight forwars
i’ll send you some code
thanks adrian

question, with the paid google site search coming down (link: <http://news.softpedia.com/news/google-to-shut-down-site-search-in-april-513191.shtml>) does this mean HubSpot will introduce a native search? What is the generally recommended path for search for HubSpot Q2 forward?  thanks!
April 1st?
yeppers
sounds like a april fools one

<@U2Q5LPHGS> - should be all set. Had to reach out to the support team at Slack, but they raised our invite limit. Please don’t invite too many people all at once (or we could run into the limit again), but it’s ok to invite a few at a time.
Thanks <@U22PU4G4A>, by now it's ok, our dev people is here to learn and help, thanks!

if only that were true.  we’re writing up a post on it, will post it here early next week with alternatives. 
I got a note from our CAM that HubSpot is not working on any search tool themselves (paraphrasing).
i think the trick is to let clients running add free know they need to boost their credits this month to cover the next year. that buys time for a new solution if they want search to not have ads.
<@U2SJA29B4> definitely share that post when it's published, I've been trying to find alternatives for a few weeks now.
I wonder if I'll be able to get dev time on making an api search now.  I've talked about it a million times at any place I've ever worked.
Of course that won't work for smaller clients that don't have api access

imho this is an opportunity.  quick story:
I built a search function for an ecommerce app that not only showed prioritized search results and adjusted the algorithm based upon conversion rate, it logged searches with no result and searches that led to exits, and stacked them by frequency of search so they could be evaluated by a human and better converting results could be manually inserted. if they searched for a product that we didn’t have, we either added it, or added a “___ alternatives” result that listed great alternatives and why we think they’re better.  

The funny part.. this was in 2007. 
I could only imagine what the wizards at HubSpot could do in 2017 to drive such thinking to another level.
I agree completely.  Using search on a website and logging the results of entered text is huge to be able to see and interpert
